programme.title: The Romanovs
programme.desc: Learning about the ascension of Catherine's son, Paul, following her death in 1796.

programme.title: The Romanovs
programme.desc: Setting the stage for the end of the Romanov Dynasty in the early decades of the 20th century.

programme.title: The Dawns Here Are Quiet
programme.desc: It is late spring of 1942, and World War 2 is in full swing. A long way off from the front-line the Germans make an air landing operation in an attempt to get through to the Kirov railway and the White Sea - Baltic Sea Canal. The only obstacle in their way is an anti-aircraft artillery unit of corporal Vaskov and five young women in training.

programme.title: The Attackers
programme.desc: Tensions rise as a man is interrogated for sabotaging a plane with sand. Granny Valya's family is drawn into the situation. Dvina's team plans a mission to attack a division's storehouse. Varka joins technicians to help fight. The story brims with intrigue and intense moments as they face the challenges of war.

programme.title: First to Fight
programme.desc: The North Korean forces had Soviet built MiG 15 jet fighters. The U.S. rapidly deployed the F-86 Sabre Jet. This led to many dogfights in the northwest part of North Korea dubbed 'MiG Alley'.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: The Communist invasion of Korea which led to the entry of the US Forces into the conflict.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: Armed Forces Assistance to Korea
programme.desc: For this film presentation in The Big Picture television series, American soldiers are shown as they lend a helping hand to Korea, a country torn apart by war. Americans have traditionally responded to the needs of friends in trouble. Here is a documentary about a gesture which started as an informal assist and has become a giant program for the rehabilitation of certain areas of Korean life.

programme.title: The US Battle For Supremacy In The Pacific
programme.desc: Career of General MacArthur, with focus on World War II action in the pacific, post-war era in Japan, and early days of fighting in Korea.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: In this issue Big Picture viewers will receive a firsthand account of how American artillery is employed in Korea. The film shows how American artillerymen fire ten shells for every one the Communists launch at our troops. Included in the film is a study of the Army's new atomic cannon...the 280mm gun.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: A Day in Korea
programme.desc: Comparison of the life of the individual in the states to the soldier on the front lines of Korea. Despite the truce talks fighting is still going on and we still have a serious need for men and machines. The contrast between their life and the life of the soldier should bring the picture closer.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Depicts the important role of artillery fire in modern warfare.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea, March 20th through April 20th 1951. The U.N. forces cross the 38th parallel - official activation of shape headquarters.

programme.title: War in the Pacific
programme.desc: Tensions begin to rise in Korea.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: United Nations Consolidate Below the 38th Parallel
programme.desc: Destruction of the Port of Hungnam...The withdrawal across the Han...U.N. defenses at Suwon...and air attacks on the Chinese border. Captain Zimmerman interviews two soldiers, Corporal Tom Miller who was a rifleman with the 1st Cavalry Division in Korea and Corporal James Jankowski of McDonald, Pennsylvania, who served with Company L in the Army's 2nd Division.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: The 2nd Infantry Division in Korea
programme.desc: Here is an exciting film documentary of the famous 'Indianheads,' the men of the U.S. 2nd Infantry Division in Korea. Although the fighting in Korea is over, the deeds of the 2nd Infantry Division will long be remembered. Out of the struggle in Korea have come many accounts of great suffering and even greater heroism, but few of them can match the story as told in this Big Picture program.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: A few years ago, the rugged Peninsula of Korea was the scene of some of the hardest and most bitter fighting of modern times. The savagery and violence from the war have been wiped away by generosity and love of the American soldier on duty in Korea. Thousands of inexperienced young men have been trained by seasoned American and Korean soldiers and turned into a smooth, well-drilled modern army.

programme.title: Wartime Aircraft of the Fleet Air Arm
programme.desc: Showcasing some of the most significant aircraft types used by the Fleet Air Arm.

programme.title: Air Power
programme.desc: Every major power develops military jets post World War II. The race to break the sound barrier begins. War breaks out in Korea in 1950 ushering in the age of jet combat.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Activities in Korea during June 20th through July 20th 1951 with emphasis on the cease-fire talks at Kaesong.

programme.title: Complete History of Air Combat
programme.sub-title: War of Korea: On to the Yalu
programme.desc: This episode dramatically details the outbreak of the world's first jet war. On June 24, 1950, Communist North Korea invaded her sister to the south, forcing a war. Within days, America had F-80s knocking out Communist supply lines.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: United Nations Forces Counterattack
programme.desc: Our allied units throw a powerful counterattack against the Reds, Infantry tanks, artillery, and air all combine to throw the Reds back to the North, The Navy blasts the enemy with rockets. Captain Zimmerman interviews Chaplain Joseph Murphy of Boston, Massachusetts, and Captain John Rock, former company commander with the 1st Cavalry Division in Korea.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: Covers the United States involvement with Korea and testing of Korean weapons. John Ford directed this film which is the only color documentary made during the Korean War.

programme.title: History Of The Korean War
programme.desc: During the Korean War, the Yalu River, which is located between what is now North and South Korea played a major role. As the U.N pushed its way towards the Yalu, China quickly got involved as they felt they had no other choice.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: The Guns Are Silent
programme.desc: Korea is still a front-line area, though the guns are silent. This truce-line documentary was filmed in the Korean Sector which is patrolled by soldiers day and night, through summer and winter. In this zone, the patrols of the Army act as eyes for all U.S. forces in Korea. The program serves as a timely reminder that what once happened in Korea must not happen again.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea during July 20th through August 20th 1951- ground action continues - return of refugees to Seoul - cease-fire talks continue.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.desc: A documented report of Communist atrocities in Korea, with scenes just released depicting the horror and brutality of Communism. Includes interviews with returned prisoners of war who were eye witnesses to some of these atrocities and Major General William Dean and General Mark W. Clark.

programme.title: First to Fight
programme.desc: The advance continues in North Korea closing to the Korean/China border. As winter starts American forces encounter Chinese troops for the first time. The Marines advance to the Chosin Reservoir.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea during February 20th through March 20th 1951. The U.N. offensive continues - Operation Killer hampered by weather.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: The 2nd Infantry Division in Korea
programme.desc: Here is an exciting film documentary of the famous 'Indianheads,' the men of the U.S. 2nd Infantry Division in Korea. Although the fighting in Korea is over, the deeds of the 2nd Infantry Division will long be remembered. Out of the struggle in Korea have come many accounts of great suffering and even greater heroism, but few of them can match the story as told in this Big Picture program.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea, April 20th through May 20th 1951 - Red Spring offensive is stalled before it starts.

programme.title: The US Battle For Supremacy In The Pacific
programme.desc: Career of General MacArthur, with focus on World War II action in the pacific, post-war era in Japan, and early days of fighting in Korea.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Combat activities in Korea, March 20th through April 20th 1951. The U.N. forces cross the 38th parallel - official activation of shape headquarters.

programme.title: Battlezone: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: United Nations Forces Counterattack
programme.desc: Our allied units throw a powerful counterattack against the Reds, Infantry tanks, artillery, and air all combine to throw the Reds back to the North, The Navy blasts the enemy with rockets. Captain Zimmerman interviews Chaplain Joseph Murphy of Boston, Massachusetts, and Captain John Rock, former company commander with the 1st Cavalry Division in Korea.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: United Nations Campaign in Northeast Korea
programme.desc: Tactical phases of attack on Pyongyang - ultimate amphibious evacuation from Hungnam (completed Christmas Eve 1950).

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.sub-title: Big Picture: The Guns Are Silent
programme.desc: Korea is still a front-line area, though the guns are silent. This truce-line documentary was filmed in the Korean Sector which is patrolled by soldiers day and night, through summer and winter. In this zone, the patrols of the Army act as eyes for all U.S. forces in Korea. The program serves as a timely reminder that what once happened in Korea must not happen again.

programme.title: Visions of War: The Korean War
programme.desc: Covers the United States involvement with Korea and testing of Korean weapons. John Ford directed this film which is the only color documentary made during the Korean War.

programme.title: Air Power
programme.desc: Every major power develops military jets post World War II. The race to break the sound barrier begins. War breaks out in Korea in 1950 ushering in the age of jet combat.
